explains: adj. 成熟的；（花）盛开的；（帆等）张满的

sentences.en: The border dispute turned into a full-blown crisis.
sentences.cn: 边境争端已演变成全面危机。

sentences.en: Before becoming a full-blown director, he worked as the film editor on Citizen Kane.
sentences.cn: 在成为一名完全成熟的导演之前，他曾担任影片《公民凯恩》的剪辑师。

sentences.en: He developed full-blown AIDS five years after contracting HIV.
sentences.cn: 他感染艾滋病病毒五年以后，患上了完全型艾滋病。
